Friday 17th October

10am – 1pm

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][image_with_animation image_url=”22215″ image_size=”full” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default” animation_type=”entrance” animation=”Fade In” animation_easing=”default” animation_movement_type=”transform_y” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1754926141513{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]The Careers in Finance event is a place for ambitious Black professionals to learn how to excel in the financial services industry. This event connects attendees with seasoned industry experts, successful finance leaders, and career development specialists to gain practical insights on how to build outstanding careers.

Through skill-building sessions and practical panel discussions, attendees will discover diverse career pathways, develop essential leadership skills, and learn how to position themselves for advancement in competitive environments. Whether you’re entering the industry or looking to accelerate your career, this event brings together a community of Black professionals ready to achieve excellence and lead the way for the next generation of talent in finance.

Key themes:
1. Discover how to access diverse career opportunities in the finance sector and beyond
2. Understand the technical expertise and soft skills that leading organisations prioritise when hiring and promoting talent
3. Learn how to build strategic relationships and mentorship opportunities to accelerate your professional growth
4. Find out how to position yourself confidently for leadership roles and stretch opportunities
5. Explore intrapreneurship and entrepreneurship opportunities to expand your career potential beyond traditional finance roles[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20″][divider column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Collette Barton

Global Head of Control Room, Executive Director, UBS[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Collette Barton is Executive Director and Global Head of the Control Room, Global Research and Global Banking Technology and Process at UBS. She has transitioned from leading global governance and compliance oversight across the firm’s sales, trading and research operations, to spearheading innovation by harnessing automation and AI capabilities, shaping best in class processes that strengthen governance and operational excellence across the Investment Bank.

Her journey began in law before moving into investment banking, where she discovered her passion and niche in managing high-stakes compliance matters.

Beyond her technical expertise, Collette prioritises mentorship, representation, and inclusive leadership, championing diverse talent and creating environments where underrepresented voices thrive. Anchored by her values, heritage, and inner resilience, she leads with both strategic clarity and heartfelt purpose.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ text_direction=”default”]

Stefan Taylor

Senior Analyst – Pricing, Moody’s Ratings[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Stefan is a Senior Analyst in Moody’s Commercial Group, where he is recognized for his ability to bridge commercial and pricing teams, through advising on complex pricing structures and supporting global relationship management efforts. Stefan contributes to strategic client engagement, while delivering commercial insights across diverse industries. Known for his collaborative leadership and inclusive approach, he supports initiatives in pricing strategy, provides training, and drives global process enhancements.

With experience spanning asset management and fintech, Stefan brings expertise in capital markets, UK financial regulations, and financial instruments, backed by advanced skills in Bloomberg, Salesforce, and Excel.

Stefan holds a first-class degree in Banking and Finance and an Investment Operations Certificate with the Chartered Institute of Securities and Investments. He is passionate about equity in finance and actively contributes to the Black Impact BRG at Moody’s.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” Iana Vidal

Head of UK Public Policy, Block[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Iana Vidal is Head of UK Public Policy for Block, a US tech company. She leads the company’s engagement with government, regulators and other key stakeholders, to influence policy and regulation that drives economic empowerment and supports innovation in financial services. Iana has extensive experience across a range of policy areas, and has previously worked for trade and professional bodies, and in the not for profit sector.

column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Abisola B. Sherwood

Director, Global Head of Governance & Oversight, AML KYC, Citi[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Abisola Barber Sherwood is a Director at Citibank, leading the Anti-Money Laundering Know Your Customer programme: delivering a robust global governance framework which embeds AML Prevention oversight across all operating jurisdictions, products and services.

Abisola joined Citi in 2021 as the Global Head of Thematic Risk for ICG Compliance: providing technical leadership and driving uniformity in approach to risk themes and policy areas crossing the institutional businesses, such as ESG, Social Media Communications and Conduct – whilst driving Transformational change initiatives.

Prior to Citi, Abisola spent close to 10 years at Barclays Bank in various roles across their Corporate and Investment Bank.

A strategic troubleshooter and global program manager, Abisola demonstrates a new age of leadership and management within the sector.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Valerie Kontor

Founder, Black in Fintech & Senior Credit Solutions Specialist, RBC Wealth Management[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Valerie’s career in fintech has centred on innovation in lending, and she now works in Wealth Management at RBC. As the Founder of Black in Fintech, she runs a network dedicated to Black representation, inclusive innovation, and developing financial products to address the needs of marginalised communities.

She has been a Product Advisor for two Black-owned start-ups, a contributor to industry-wide roundtables and events, including Money 20/20, and a representative of the UK on the first fintech trade mission to Africa. She has also been recognised on the Women in Fintech Powerlist for three years running and was an Inspiring Fifty 2025 awardee. She is deeply passionate about the future of finance and harnessing technology to solve real-world problems.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” Lorraine Wright MBE

Director, LW Business Group[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Lorraine Wright MBE is a British-Ghanaian entrepreneur, Oxford Executive MBA graduate, and former Director at UBS, where she led global digital transformation projects across wealth management and investment banking. With over 15 years of experience spanning finance, tech, education, and property, she combines corporate expertise with a deep passion for building generational wealth and community impact.

Through her consultancy brand, Diaspora to Home, under LW Business Group, Lorraine provides strategic guidance to diaspora professionals looking to invest in property across Ghana. Her platform has supported hundreds in navigating cross-border investments with clarity, confidence, and cultural insight — bridging finance, legacy, and opportunity.

Named one of the 2023 Top 25 Black Entrepreneurs to Watch, Lorraine was also awarded an MBE for services to young people and entrepreneurship.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” Demola Ayilara

Finance Analyst, eBay UK[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Demola Ayilara is a Finance Analyst at eBay UK, where he supports financial strategy and decision making for one of the world’s most influential ecommerce platforms. Working in a fast paced, data driven environment, Demola brings sharp analytical insight and a strategic mindset to drive business performance and impact.

He is passionate about redefining modern finance leadership, and uses data, technology, and storytelling to solve problems, influence strategy, and inspire change. His expertise includes financial modelling, forecasting, and performance analytics, with a growing focus on the role of AI and digital tools in the future of finance.

Demola is committed to continuous growth, and to empowering the next generation of diverse finance talent to lead with clarity, confidence, and purpose.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” text_direction=”default”]

Abigail Kwao

Vice President, EMEA Digital Wealth Sales, BlackRock[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Abigail Kwao is a Vice President within BlackRock’s EMEA Digital Wealth Sales team, based in London.  Shel is responsible for driving strategy, sales, and investment partnerships with leading D2C platforms and digital wealth providers across the UK. Since joining the Digital Wealth team, Abigail has played a central role in expanding BlackRock’s UK digital wealth business, including pioneering the development of its retail retirement strategy and the execution of flagship partnerships with major neobanks and brokers. Beyond her client-facing role, Abigail is a founding member of BlackRock’s EMEA Black Professional Network, championing diversity and inclusion across the firm. She holds a BSc in Finance, Accounting and Management from the University of Nottingham, the Investment Management Certificate (IMC), and the Chartered Insurance Institute Certificate in Pensions and Retirement Planning. Ella Weinberg

Financial Expert & Entrepreneur[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Ella Weinberg is a UK-based financial consultant specialising in insurance, credit improvement and estate planning. She has placed over £1 billion worth of insurance and supported hundreds of clients in securing their financial futures.

A multi-award-winning professional, Ella was recognised as BBC 1Xtra’s 2024 Founding Figures Award Winner, celebrating her impact in financial education and empowerment. She also serves as the Chairwoman of the University of Greenwich Enterprise Board, where she mentors emerging entrepreneurs and champions financial literacy among young professionals.

Ella’s work bridges technical expertise with real-world understanding empowering individuals and families to protect, rebuild, and grow their wealth through transparent guidance and practical education. Whether she’s advising on critical illness cover, removing CCJs, or simplifying wills and legacy planning, her mission remains simple: to ensure financial security and confidence at every stage of life.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Demola Ayilara

Finance Analyst, eBay UK[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Demola Ayilara is a Finance Analyst at eBay UK, where he supports financial strategy and decision making for one of the world’s most influential ecommerce platforms. Working in a fast paced, data driven environment, Demola brings sharp analytical insight and a strategic mindset to drive business performance and impact.

He is passionate about redefining modern finance leadership, and uses data, technology, and storytelling to solve problems, influence strategy, and inspire change. His expertise includes financial modelling, forecasting, and performance analytics, with a growing focus on the role of AI and digital tools in the future of finance.

Demola is committed to continuous growth, and to empowering the next generation of diverse finance talent to lead with clarity, confidence, and purpose.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Fumbi Banjoko

Senior Director, Global Sales Development, Visa Direct[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Fumbi Banjoko is a dynamic global leader with a proven track record of building, coaching and empowering diverse high-performing teams that consistently exceed multi-million-pound revenue goals. With experience across public and private sectors, she combines strategic execution with cultural transformation – driving business growth while fostering inclusive workplaces that strengthen engagement, retention and long-term success.

Since pivoting into FinTech five years ago, Fumbi has championed greater representation of women and Black professionals, spearheading initiatives to expand female talent pipelines at Visa, launching the first cultural ERG at Currencycloud, and mentoring both secondary school students and emerging leaders through M2020’s Amplify and Rise Up programmes. Passionate about equity and inclusion, she is recognised for “walking the talk” and inspiring the next generation of leaders.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ Nkechi Anyanwu

Founding Product Engineer, Vouchsafe
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Nkechi Anyanwu is a full-stack product engineer and multidisciplinary technologist with a unique blend of engineering expertise and business acumen from her background in investment banking and strategy consulting. She’s passionate about building products that reshape the way people interact with the world and each other, and she’s currently doing this at Vouchsafe, where she’s a founding engineer building the future of KYC and digital identity. She started her career as an Investment banker at Bank of America before pivoting to become a software engineer.  

Alongside her professional work, she’s actively building and investing in products, including an AI SaaS product currently in beta testing. She enjoys sharing knowledge, whether through writing, talks, or workshops that make complex concepts intuitive for other builders.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” Anthony David King

Fintech Investor and Founder, Anthony David King Capital[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Anthony is the founder of Anthony David King Capital, ADK, and a fintech investor.  Anthony David King Capital partners with exceptional founders and leverages a network of banks, non-banks, and private credit for growth capital to build companies, fund investments, and do acquisitions. ADK is a venture partner building and advising venture programmes for corporations, banks, and governments around the world, including Sberbank, Bank of Korea, Higo Bank in Japan, and others across the UK, Europe, and Africa. As an investor, Anthony focuses on fintech platforms shaping the future of finance and banking. This has included Moneybox, the savings and investing superapp; Yonder, the experiences and rewards credit card; and Eversend, Africa’s first Neobank.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Misky Sharif

Account Executive, Revolut[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Misky Sharif is a London-based sales leader and fintech specialist currently serving as an Account Executive at Revolut Business. With a strong background in sales, she is passionate about mentorship and community building, and has spoken on Women in Sales panels and at Money20/20 events. Misky also hosts events with Making Moves and contributes to Women in Tech forums, where she shares insights on professional growth, diversity and inclusion, and overcoming imposter syndrome.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” top_margin=”5%”
